intro: Connarus puberulus, commonly known as the hairy connarus, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in fine pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Connarus puberulus is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
